trial_identification.studytitle: Continuous Measurement of Oxygen Consumption from the Airway in intubated Patients attached to a Ventilator Circuit - An Observational Study
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Continuous Measurement of Oxygen Consumption from the Airway in Intubated Patients attached to a Ventilator Circuit - An Observational Study

conditions.healthcondition: We seek to produce a simple, easy-to-use, cost-effective oxygen consumption measurement device.

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Normal development and function of the cardiovascular system
Normal development and function of the respiratory system

interventions.interventions: Inspired and expired oxygen fraction are sampled sequentially using a common electrode. Mixed expired pCO2 is measured. Oxygen is precision added to the mixed expired gas until, allowing for water vapour and CO2, the mixed expired pO2 equals the inspired pO2. The rate of oxygen addition then equals the oxygen consumption. The duration of observation will be about 6 hours.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Continuous measurement of oxygen consumption. The rate of 02 consumption is equal to the rate of 02 addition when the corrected expired p02 is equal to the inspired p02.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Whilst the patient is intubated and attached to a ventilator circuit for up to 24 hours.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Intubated Patients attached to a ventilator circuit. Pregnant women included
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Patients not requiring to be intubated.

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: Monash Medical Centre 246 Clayton Road Clayton, Victoria, 3168

fundingsource.fundingaddress: Monash Medical Centre 246 Clayton Rd., Clayton, Victoria, 3168

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The project seeks to measure oxygen consumption by precision addition of oxygen to the mixed expired gas until the mixed expired pO2 equals the inspired pO2
